text: Thanks for setting this up Chelsea! I’ll take a closer look this afternoon, but it looks great at first sight! I noticed you hadn’t put in the question about the topics for next semester, and was thinking it might be better to do that separately after all, as maybe some people will be more likely to fill out the topics poll if it is separate from the feedback survey? What do you think?

root.text: Hi team, I have completed a draft of the end of semester feedback survey in Qualtrics. I have given you all permissions to access and edit the survey in qualtrics, so feel free to edit anything you would like directly. Alternatively, you can look at the survey using the following link and make comments in a thread below. <https://survey.ucalgary.ca/jfe/form/SV_8H6HYwAMyInihs9>

text: Hi Gwen. I did have a question about that. Actually now that I’m looking at the survey on my phone through the link I sent it looks a bit messed up, the questions are all in the wrong order and some do not reflect the most recent edits I made. I’m not sure why - going to try to figure that out today

text: Do you mean the one about suggestions for topics/presenters? I think that one is great, and should definitely be kept, I was just thinking of the kind of poll we did at the start of the semester, with the different topics we have in mind for next semester and letting everyone vote for say the 4 topics they would most like to discuss next semester

elements.text: Do you mean the one about suggestions for topics/presenters? text: And great that you checked it on your phone, I’ve only looked on my computer so far, and it looks okay there, but I know things can be very different on phones :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: And great that you checked it on your phone, I’ve only looked on my computer so far, and it looks okay there, but I know things can be very different on phones

text: Ohh I see. My thought with that is that we can collect ideas from members and then do a separate poll later on on slack incorporating those ideas and our own. Open to anything tho!

elements.text: Ohh I see. My thought with that is that we can collect ideas from members and then do a separate poll later on on slack incorporating those ideas and our own. Open to anything tho!

text: Hmm yeah that would make sense too. I guess I would really like to pin down at least the first topic for next semester before we take a break, and I didn’t think that would fit in terms of timing, but it might still, say if we have the end of semester survey open for one week (Dec 5-12), and then do the poll immediately after?

elements.text: Hmm yeah that would make sense too. I guess I would really like to pin down at least the first topic for next semester before we take a break, and I didn’t think that would fit in terms of timing, but it might still, say if we have the end of semester survey open for one week (Dec 5-12), and then do the poll immediately after?

text: I think the survey is great Chelsea! One thing that Emiko mentioned and I think might be nice to add is just general questions about EDI e.g. asking if participants feel there is space for all/diverse voices/ideas, or if there is something we could do to incorporate EDI more specifically into our group - what do you all think about that?

I think the survey is great Chelsea! One thing that Emiko mentioned and I think might be nice to add is just general questions about EDI e.g. asking if participants feel there is space for all/diverse voices/ideas, or if there is something we could do to incorporate EDI more specifically into our group - what do you all think about that?
